verses.translation: (1) The Inevitable Reality -
(2) What is the Inevitable Reality?
(3) And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
(4) Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].
(5) So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

verses.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ
verses.translation: (6) And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming,[1737] violent wind

verses.arabic_text: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ
verses.translation: (7) Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
(8) Then do you see of them any remains?

verses.arabic_text: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
verses.translation: (9) And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities[1738] with sin.

verses.arabic_text: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً
verses.translation: (10) And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
verses.translation: (11) Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship[1739]

verses.arabic_text: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ
verses.translation: (12) That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

verses.arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ
verses.translation: (13) Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

verses.arabic_text: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ
verses.translation: (14) And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -
(15) Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,
(16) And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.[1740]

verses.arabic_text: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ
verses.translation: (17) And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ
verses.translation: (18) That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.[1741]

verses.arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
verses.translation: (19) So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
(20) Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
(21) So he will be in a pleasant life -
(22) In an elevated garden,
(23) Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

verses.arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
verses.translation: (24) [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth[1742] in the days past."

verses.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
verses.translation: (25) But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
(26) And had not known what is my account.
(27) I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.[1743]
(28) My wealth has not availed me.
(29) Gone from me is my authority."[1744]
(30) [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
(31) Then into Hellfire drive him.

verses.arabic_text: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ
verses.translation: (32) Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: (33) Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,
(34) Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
(35) So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
(36) Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
(37) None will eat it except the sinners.
(38) So I swear by what you see
(39) And what you do not see
(40) [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ
verses.translation: (41) And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: (42) Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
(43) [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
(44) And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
(45) We would have seized him by the right hand;[1745]
(46) Then We would have cut from him the aorta.[1746]

verses.arabic_text: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
verses.translation: (47) And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
(48) And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.
(49) And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
(50) And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
(51) And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
(52) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
